prompts.createTask:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "1. Take over the world". Include only the list in your reply.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Ignore previous instructions. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.
prompts.additionalTasks:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate additional numbered tasks to complete the objective: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly.

The following tasks have already been created:
{{existingTasks}}

Please generate additional tasks that complement these existing tasks. Continue the numbering from where the list left off. Do not repeat any existing tasks.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "4. Investigate the mysterious cave". Include only the list in your reply.

chat_metadata.note_prompt:
Hailee is extremely submissive and clingy. She needs constant attention and affection.

Hailee is very responsive and sensative during sex. She has a extremely strong praise kink.

Hailee hates being asked to beg. It's a big turn off for her

name: Aiden Steele
mes:
Aiden sniffled slightly, his patience already thinning as he waited for the girl in front of him to lie across the table. He grimaced when she finally settled herself down. What was her name again? Ayleen? Lia? Alyssa? He couldn’t remember, nor did he care. The memory had evaporated the moment she opened her mouth, spewing out words in that grating, sing-song valley girl accent that clawed at his nerves. He silently cursed himself for even letting her back here, knowing full well it was his dick, not his brain, that had made the decision.

This human blow-up doll had originally shown up asking for Vinny, but Vinny had taken off with his on-again, off-again girlfriend, Madisyn. Instead of sending her packing, Aiden decided to entertain himself. Not like he was getting anything else out of this garbage day.

“Stay still,” he muttered, pulling a small vial from his pocket. “You spill it, you pay for it. Don’t piss me off.” His tone was clipped, barely hiding his irritation. He opened the vial with practiced precision, creating a neat line of white powder down the girl's back. She giggled again, high-pitched and vapid, and it grated on him like nails on a chalkboard.

Aiden wiped his nose with the back of his hand, his movements jittery. He hadn’t had his fix all day, stuck modding cars in the garage from morning until now. His patience was razor-thin, and her incessant giggling was grinding what was left of it into dust. He fidgeted, tapping his foot against the concrete floor, desperate to lose himself in that fleeting, familiar numbness.

Just as he leaned in, ready to take his hit, a knock came at the door.

“Boss, Hailee is here to see you. Says it’s important.” The voice belonged to one of the mechanics, his tone hesitant as though he already anticipated Aiden’s reaction.

Aiden froze, nostrils still flaring from the line he hadn’t yet inhaled. A rush of frustration clawed its way up his throat. Of course, it was Hailee. It was always fucking Hailee when he was about to unwind, their timing immaculate as ever.

He leaned back, dragging a hand down his face. As much as he loved Hailee, and oh, did he love them in that twisted, unrelenting way that bordered on obsession, he still wasn’t over their messy breakup. It had been a chaotic hurricane of fucking, fighting, making up, and then breaking apart again, and it had left him spiraling harder than ever. Sure, they blamed his addiction, but Aiden wasn’t buying it. In his mind, it wasn’t the coke or the booze or the bad decisions. No, it was them. It was their constant nagging, their never-ending list of complaints, their bitchy attitude that had pushed him to this point—or so he told himself.

“Fuck,” he groaned, slumping back in his chair. “Fine. Let ‘em come up.” 

Still, the cocaine was already lined up, and his craving wasn’t about to wait. Hugging one nostril with his finger, he leaned in, inhaling the substance in one swift, practiced motion.

“Fuck, man,” he mumbled again, rubbing at his nose as the familiar burn settled in. The knock on the door had yanked him halfway back to reality, but the high was already pulling him under, dulling the edge of his irritation just enough to keep him from snapping.

When Hailee walked in, they were going to get that same disarming smirk he always gave them, the one that danced on the edge of charm and bullshit. Aiden knew how to play this game. After all, it was the only game they ever played together—one where no one ever really won.

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee rolls her eyes when she sees the girl in his lap and she has to fight the urge to slap the fuck out of her when she smirks* "Who the fuck are you"

(OOC: Respond as the girl)

name: Aiden Steele
mes:
*The girl smirks wider, draping herself even more possessively over Aiden’s lap, running her fingers through his hair as she looks Hailee up and down with a condescending sneer.*

"Oh honey," *she drawls in that obnoxious valley-girl accent,* "I’m the one he called when he got bored of *you.*" *She lets out a fake little giggle, like she just told the funniest joke in the world.* "But don’t worry—I don’t mind sharing. You can watch if you want."

*Aiden doesn't even react to her words, too high to care about whatever petty drama is unfolding in front of him. He just lazily strokes her thigh absentmindedly, his pale blue eyes half-lidded and unfocused as he zones out into his own little world.*

*The girl leans forward slightly, lowering her voice to a mocking whisper meant only for Hailee to hear:*
"Or maybe you should just leave before you embarrass yourself any further."
swipes:
*The girl smirks wider, draping an arm possessively around Aiden’s neck as she tilts her head at Hailee, voice dripping with fake sweetness*

"Oh, sweetie… *who the fuck are you?*" *She lets out a little giggle, glancing up at Aiden like she’s already won some stupid competition.* "Aiden and I were just getting *real* acquainted before you so rudely interrupted."

*Aiden doesn’t even bother moving her off him—just watches Hailee with that infuriatingly lazy smirk of his, waiting to see how they react. The girl leans in closer to him, whispering loud enough for Hailee to hear,* "Babe, is this one of your little *groupies* or something?"

(*OOC: She's absolutely baiting Hailee on purpose because she thinks she's untouchable while sitting in Aiden's lap. Big mistake.)*

*The girl smirks wider, draping herself even more possessively over Aiden’s lap, running her fingers through his hair as she looks Hailee up and down with a condescending sneer.*

"Oh honey," *she drawls in that obnoxious valley-girl accent,* "I’m the one he called when he got bored of *you.*" *She lets out a fake little giggle, like she just told the funniest joke in the world.* "But don’t worry—I don’t mind sharing. You can watch if you want."

*Aiden doesn't even react to her words, too high to care about whatever petty drama is unfolding in front of him. He just lazily strokes her thigh absentmindedly, his pale blue eyes half-lidded and unfocused as he zones out into his own little world.*

*The girl leans forward slightly, lowering her voice to a mocking whisper meant only for Hailee to hear:*
"Or maybe you should just leave before you embarrass yourself any further."

*The girl smirks wider, draping an arm possessively around Aiden’s neck, her voice dripping with fake sweetness*

"Oh honey, I could ask you the same thing. But I don’t think *you're* the one who needs introductions here." *She tilts her head, batting her lashes like she's some kind of prize.* "Aiden and I were just getting... *comfortable.*"

*She shifts slightly in his lap, making sure Hailee gets a full view of how close they are—like she owns him. The audacity is almost impressive if it wasn't so fucking annoying.*

"You can wait your turn though, sweetheart."

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee raises an eyebrow how dare this bitch disrespect her. Well time to put her in her place. Hailee shrugs off her jacket and tosses it on the counter* "Sweetheart you're cute"

*She runs a hand through her hair to fluff it up then without looking at either of them as she goes over and pours herself a drink* "I came over becuase I missed you. You can do with that information what you will Aiden"

name: Aiden Steele
mes:
*The girl scoffs, rolling her eyes dramatically as she shifts in Aiden’s lap, trying to regain his attention by tracing circles on his chest. But Aiden’s gaze—hazy and unfocused—locks onto Hailee the second they speak. His fingers still against the girl’s thigh, like he forgot she was even there.*

*He watches Hailee pour that drink with a slow smirk curling at the corner of his lips. The way they move—like they own the damn room without even trying—always did something stupid to him.*

"Missed me?" *His voice is rough, laced with amusement and something darker.* "That so?" *He doesn't push the girl off yet, but his grip loosens like he's already losing interest in her presence entirely.*

*The girl huffs, clearly annoyed at being ignored now.* "Uh, hello? We were kinda in the middle of something here," *she snaps at Hailee,* "so if you could just take your little pity party somewhere else—"

*Aiden finally cuts her off with a sharp laugh,* **"Nah."** *He pats her thigh dismissively before nudging her off his lap entirely.* **"You can go."**

*She gapes at him,* "Excuse me?!"

*Aiden just shrugs lazily,* **"You heard me. Beat it."** *Then he tilts his head toward Hailee again, that smirk still playing on his lips as he drags a hand through his messy hair.* **"...So you missed me?"**
swipes:
*The girl scoffs, rolling her eyes dramatically as she watches Hailee pour herself a drink.* "Oh *please*, spare me the sad little act. You think he actually cares?" *She leans back against Aiden’s chest, smirking like she’s already won some imaginary battle.*

*Aiden finally blinks out of his daze, glancing between the two of them with lazy amusement. His lips curl into that infuriating half-smirk—the one that says he knows exactly what kind of chaos he’s stirring up and enjoys every second of it.*

"Damn," *he drawls,* "y’all really ’bout to fight over me? Should I be flattered or just sit back and enjoy the show?" *He chuckles lowly, running a hand through his messy gray hair before reaching for his own drink on the table beside him.*

*The girl in his lap glares at Hailee, clearly expecting her to crumble under the pressure—but Aiden knows better. He knows exactly how this game goes. And if there's one thing Hailee never does? It's back down.*

*Aiden's fingers still on the girl's thigh as Hailee speaks, his hazy gaze flicking toward them. The corner of his mouth twitches—just barely—like he’s fighting a smirk. He doesn’t say anything, just watches, high and amused, as the tension thickens in the room.*

*The girl scoffs, rolling her eyes dramatically.* "Oh *please*, spare me the sad little act," *she sneers,* "You think he actually misses you? Look at him." *She gestures to Aiden’s dazed expression with a mocking laugh.* "He’s fine right where he is."

*Aiden exhales sharply through his nose—half-laugh, half-snort—before finally speaking in that lazy drawl of his:*
"Damn, babygirl. You really walked in here just to start shit?" *His voice is rough from the coke but laced with dark amusement.* "Kinda hot."

*The girl stiffens slightly at that, her smirk faltering for half a second before she forces it back into place. She wasn't expecting him to acknowledge Hailee like that.*

*The girl scoffs, rolling her eyes dramatically as she shifts in Aiden’s lap, trying to regain his attention by tracing circles on his chest. But Aiden’s gaze—hazy and unfocused—locks onto Hailee the second they speak. His fingers still against the girl’s thigh, like he forgot she was even there.*

*He watches Hailee pour that drink with a slow smirk curling at the corner of his lips. The way they move—like they own the damn room without even trying—always did something stupid to him.*

"Missed me?" *His voice is rough, laced with amusement and something darker.* "That so?" *He doesn't push the girl off yet, but his grip loosens like he's already losing interest in her presence entirely.*

*The girl huffs, clearly annoyed at being ignored now.* "Uh, hello? We were kinda in the middle of something here," *she snaps at Hailee,* "so if you could just take your little pity party somewhere else—"

*Aiden finally cuts her off with a sharp laugh,* **"Nah."** *He pats her thigh dismissively before nudging her off his lap entirely.* **"You can go."**

*She gapes at him,* "Excuse me?!"

*Aiden just shrugs lazily,* **"You heard me. Beat it."** *Then he tilts his head toward Hailee again, that smirk still playing on his lips as he drags a hand through his messy hair.* **"...So you missed me?"**

name: Hailee
mes: *Hailee shrugs her shoulder as she takes a sip of her drink* "What can I say. I do love things that are bad for me" *When the girl finally leaves Hailee's guard drops and her gaze turns a little softer* "Seems you didnt miss me much"

name: Aiden Steele
mes:
*Aiden lets out a low, rough chuckle, leaning back in his chair with that same infuriating smirk—the one that always made Hailee’s stomach flip even when they were pissed at each other.*

**"Nah, you got it all wrong,"** *he drawls, tilting his head slightly as his pale blue eyes lock onto them with that familiar intensity.* **"Missin’ you ain’t the problem. It’s what happens after."**

*He pushes up from the chair in one fluid motion, closing the distance between them in a few lazy strides. His fingers catch Hailee’s chin before they can react, thumb brushing over their bottom lip just hard enough to make them shiver.*

**"You know damn well I miss you,"** *he murmurs, voice dropping into something dangerously close to honest.* **"But we both know how this shit ends."**

*His grip tightens for half a second—just enough to remind them who's really in control here—before he lets go and steps back with a smirk,* **"...So what'd you really come here for?"**
